title: Surface Water Well
excerpt:
•	Size: (25-35 meters) 80-100 ft. 
•	Individuals: 200-400.
•	Electrical insert pump of 1 hp.
•	1000 liter PVC tank.
•	6 tap with background cladded in ceramic.
•	Concrete base of 3 meters height.
•	Solar energy unit will be added if there is no power.

featured_image.alt_text: Villagers celebrating the completion of building water well in africa

contents.body: Help Build Surface Water Wells in Africa: Give the Gift of Water

Sub-Saharan Africa grapples with a staggering 40% of its population—approximately 783 million people—deprived of clean drinking water. In this context, each surface well acts as a beacon of hope, serving not only as a source of life but also as a vital lifeline for those lacking access, offering a means to quench the thirst and preserve the lives of many.
How Your Donations Help Build Sustainable Water Solutions
At Africa Relief, each donation you make is more than just a contribution; it's a vital part of our mission to bring sustainable water solutions to communities that need them most.

body: Site Selection: Your donations initiate the well-building process by supporting the crucial step of identifying and selecting the most sustainable locations for new wells. This ensures that every well serves a community effectively and for the long term.

Drilling: Funding is then directed towards drilling, where specialized equipment pierces through the earth to access clean water deep underground. This stage is vital for setting up a reliable water supply.
Construction: Contributions help in the construction phase, where wells are securely built and equipped with necessary hardware to ensure that they are safe and durable for community use.

Grand Opening: Finally, your support brings us to the grand opening—the celebratory moment when a new well is ready to provide a steady supply of clean water to a community, transforming lives and fostering health and development.

contents.body: Each of these stages is crucial, and your support helps us move seamlessly from one phase to the next.
Explore the Impact of Surface Water Wells on African Villages
A Surface water well can be the community's Lifeline

body: Improved Health: Reduces waterborne diseases by providing access to clean and safe drinking water.
Agricultural Advancements: Enables consistent irrigation, enhancing food security and agricultural productivity.
Empowering Women and Children: Cuts travel time for water collection, freeing time for education and economic activities.
Cultural Sustainability: Supports cultural practices and community gatherings that depend on water access.
Environmental Benefits: Helps in maintaining the local ecosystem by providing a controlled and sustainable water source.

contents.body: Join Us in Bringing Clean Water to Remote Areas through Surface Water Wells
Together, we can achieve remarkable transformations in the lives of thousands by providing access to safe, clean water.
Donate: Every contribution counts. Your donations help us purchase necessary materials, employ local labor, and ensure the sustainability of water projects.
Educate: Spread the word about the importance of clean water initiatives. By raising awareness, you increase the support that drives our projects forward.

Corporate Partnership: Encourage your company to partner with us. Corporate sponsorships can dramatically increase the reach and impact of our projects, bringing essential resources to those in desperate need.

meta_title: Help Building Surface Water Well in Africa - Donate now
meta_description: Join Africa Relief in providing clean water through building Surface Water Wells in Africa. Ensure sustainable clean water access.

title: Building Solar Water Wells in Africa
excerpt:
•	Individuals 600-800.
•	Size: (70-80meters) 230-262 ft.
•	Electrical insert pump of 2 hp.
•	3000 liter PVC tank.
•	10 tap with background cladded in ceramic.
•	Concrete base of 2.5 – 3 meters height.

featured_image.alt_text: Learn About our project Sadaqah Wells - Africa Relief

contents.body: Every drop, powered by the sun, a life-changing oasis in arid lands

In many African regions, access to clean water remains a significant challenge, affecting health, education, and overall quality of life. At Africa Relief, we are committed to changing that by building solar-powered wells, providing sustainable, safe water sources to communities in need. Our work empowers women and children, reduces waterborne illnesses, and fosters educational opportunities.
Empowering Women and Children through Building Wells in Africa

Access to clean water is a crucial element in empowering women and children in African communities. In many regions, the task of fetching water falls on women and young girls, often requiring hours of daily travel. This not only exposes them to safety risks but also deprives them of valuable time that could be spent on education or economic activities.

By building solar-powered wells, Africa Relief reduces the burden on women and children, providing them with safer and more reliable water sources. This initiative leads to improved health outcomes, increased school attendance for girls, and greater opportunities for women to engage in income-generating activities. These wells also create safer communities by reducing the risks associated with long treks to remote water sources.
How Africa Relief Builds Solar-Powered Wells
Africa Relief uses a sustainable approach to building solar-powered wells, emphasizing long-term reliability and reduced environmental impact.

body: Site assessment to determine the optimal location for the well. This includes evaluating accessibility, groundwater levels, and the specific needs of the community.
Solar panels are installed to power the water pump, reducing operational costs and providing a consistent water supply, even in areas with limited infrastructure.

Collaboration with local communities to establish maintenance teams. These teams receive training on basic repairs and upkeep, ensuring the solar-powered wells continue to function efficiently over time.

contents.body: The Impact of Solar Wells: Success Stories

The impact of solar wells is evident in the success stories from communities where Africa Relief has installed them. In one such example, a rural village in Africa experienced a dramatic reduction in waterborne diseases after a solar-powered well was installed. This led to improved health outcomes for the entire community, with fewer cases of cholera and diarrhea.

In another success story, a school in a remote area saw an increase in attendance, especially among young girls, after a solar-powered well was installed nearby. This not only provided a reliable source of clean water for the school but also reduced the time girls spent collecting water, allowing them to focus on their education.

These success stories illustrate the transformative power of solar wells in African communities. They not only provide clean water but also contribute to improved health, education, and economic development, ultimately creating a brighter future for those who benefit from these sustainable projects.

meta_title: Building Solar Water Wells in Africa - Africa Relief
meta_description: Building Solar wells in Africa transforms lives by reducing the burden on women and children, improving health, and creating opportunities for growth

title: Educational Center
excerpt: In Africa, where knowledge is power, 20% lack formal schooling, while 28% completed primary, 37% secondary, and 15% higher education, these statistics highligh the importance of accessible learning opportunities

featured_image.alt_text: Image of a classroom project funded through DonorsChoose, illustrating direct support to public school teachers

contents.body: Educational Centers, where minds flourish and futures bloom

In Africa, the pursuit of education remains pivotal, with staggering statistics showing that one in five adults lacks formal education. ARCD's Relief champions start the change through Educational Centers, bridging this gap by providing accessible and quality education. These centers serve as catalysts for transformation, nurturing young minds, and illuminating paths to a brighter future.
African Education Charities - Empowering Through Knowledge

African education charities play a pivotal role in transforming this landscape by empowering communities through knowledge and learning. Organizations like Africa Relief are at the forefront of this change, championing the cause of education across various African nations. Through the establishment of Educational Centers, these charities provide a beacon of hope and a reliable pathway to personal and community upliftment.
The Challenge: Educational Accessibility in Africa

In Africa, access to quality education remains a significant challenge that affects millions. Despite advancements in educational policies and infrastructures, a substantial portion of the population lacks basic literacy and educational opportunities. The statistics are sobering:

body: Approximately 20% of African adults have had no formal schooling.
Only 28% have completed primary education, leaving many without the skills needed for personal and professional development.
Secondary education completion stands at 37%, indicating a significant dropout rate after primary school.
Higher education reaches a mere 15%, highlighting limited access to university-level studies.

contents.body: These figures underscore a critical need: to bridge the vast educational divide and provide equitable learning opportunities for all. Factors contributing to this challenge include insufficient funding, remote geographical locations, lack of qualified teachers, and socioeconomic disparities that prioritize short-term labor over education for many families.
How You Can Help Support Education in Africa
Donate Now to Support Education in Africa

Our initiative is dedicated to reversing these troubling trends by providing critical educational support.

featured_image.alt_text: A person receiving a hearing aid, a life-changing moment thanks to generous donations.

contents.body: Hearing isn't just a sense; it's a connection to life's symphony, restoring joy and communication.

The WHO estimates that 136 million Africans face some level of hearing loss. Particularly concerning is the prevalence of childhood hearing loss due to ear infections and inadequate treatment, urging immediate hearing aid device support.
How to Donate Hearing Aids - Give the Gift of Hearing
Africa Relief invites you to directly contribute to the purchase and distribution of hearing aids through our cash donation program. Here's how you can make a profound difference:

body: Choose Your Impact: Decide on the number of hearing devices you'd like to fund.

Recurring Support for Ongoing Impact (Optional): Consider making your donation a monthly commitment. Regular contributions enable us to plan more effectively and reach more individuals over time.
Donate Now: Once you've selected your donation amount and frequency, simply click “Donate Now” to complete your contribution.

contents.body: Every contribution, big or small, plays a crucial role in our mission to turn silence into sound.
From Your Hands to Their Ears: Donating Hearing Aids to Those in Need

Once your donation is received, it embarks on a journey of transformation. Our team works diligently with local partners and experts in Africa to identify the most effective ways to utilize your funds, ensuring that they meet the pressing needs of hearing-impaired individuals.
Hearing Aids to Hope: How Your Donation Helps Bridge the Gap

The gap between those needing hearing assistance and the available resources in Africa is vast. But every donation we receive helps to bridge this divide. Your contribution directly supports our comprehensive hearing aid project.

With just $250, you can sponsor one device that will open up a world of sounds to someone. Your ongoing support, especially through monthly donations, enables us to plan ahead and reach even more individuals.

Together, we're not just donating devices; we're investing in brighter futures and creating a chorus of voices that can now be heard. Your generosity turns the dream of hearing into a reality for countless individuals, lighting up lives with the sound of hope.

title: Zakat Al-Fitr
excerpt: As we approach Eid Al Fitr 2024, one of the most frequently asked questions is how to calculate zakat al fitr. The amount of Zakat Al-Fitr is equivalent to the cost of about 2.5 to 3 kilograms of the chosen staple food. This typically translates to $15 per individual.

featured_image.alt_text: Individuals contributing to charitable causes as an essential part of their Eid al-Fitr celebrations

contents.body: Zakat Al-Fitr exemplifies the essence of charity and unity
Embrace the spirit of giving with Zakat al-Fitr, a crucial pillar of Islam that embodies compassion and community at the heart of Eid al-Fitr celebrations
What is Zakat Al-Fitr?

Zakat Al-Fitr is not only a financial aid but a symbolic gesture that cleanses the giver and offers much-needed support to the receiver. It's an integral part of Eid al-Fitr Zakat, emphasizing that no one should be left behind during the Eid celebrations. By contributing to a Zakat charity donation, you are partaking in a centuries-old tradition of generosity and care.
How much is zakat al fitr 2024?
For 2024, as a guideline for those in the U.S. is to consider the amount equivalent to the cost of about 2.5 to 3 kilograms of the chosen staple food. This typically translates to $15 per individual.
Zakat Al-Fitr must be paid before the Eid al-Fitr prayer, allowing those in need to partake in the celebration of Eid.

Zakat Al-Fitr is determined by the cost of approximately one Sa'—an Islamic measure equating to roughly 2.5 to 3 kilograms—of a staple food item in your locality. In the context of the U.S., this staple food could be wheat, barley, dates, or raisins, among others. The specific amount to be given as Zakat Al-Fitr can differ significantly based on where you live, the current cost of living, and the staple food you choose to calculate it by.
Pay Zakat Al-Fitr: Making Your Zakat Al-Fitr Donation Simplified

This Eid, let your Zakat Al-Fitr donation be a beacon of hope for those in need. Whether you're contributing to Eid Fitr donation, or seeking to donate Eid in Africa, your generosity paves the way for a brighter, more inclusive celebration. Join Africa Relief in extending your hand to those awaiting your support. Donate today and turn the spirit of Eid into a global celebration of generosity and unity.

meta_title: Calculate & Donate Zakat Al-Fitr with Africa Relief
meta_description: As we approach Eid Al Fitr 2024, one of the most frequently asked questions is how to calculate zakat al fitr. The amount of Zakat Al-Fitr is

title: Zakat Al-Mal
excerpt: Zakat Al-Mal embodies the spirit of generosity, providing essential aid to uplift lives and communities

featured_image.alt_text: A generous individual giving money to a charity as part of their Zakat donation

contents.body: Your Zakat extends a hand of hope, laying the groundwork for prosperity among those seeking aid.
Contribute Zakat Al-Mal to create a ripple of positive change. Your generosity creates opportunities and transforms lives for the better.
What is zakat al mal?

Zakat al-Mal, often simply referred to as Zakat, is one of the Five Pillars of Islam and a fundamental act of worship. It is a mandatory form of almsgiving, required of all eligible Muslims, serving not only as a means of purifying one's wealth but also as a tool to alleviate poverty and inequality within the Muslim community.

To be liable for Zakat, one must be a Muslim, an adult, in possession of wealth above the Nisab threshold, and have owned this wealth for a lunar year (Hawl). Zakat is not just on cash savings but also includes assets such as gold, silver, investments, and income-generating properties, minus liabilities.
How to calculate zakat al mal?

Calculating Zakat al-Mal can be greatly simplified by utilizing Zakat calculators, especially beneficial for those looking to contribute towards relief efforts in Africa. Following the basic steps to determine your Zakat, there's an even easier method to ensure your contributions are accurate and impactful:

body: Check Nisab: Verify if your wealth is above the Nisab threshold, indicating Zakat is obligatory for you.
List Assets: Compile all Zakatable assets, including cash, investments, and precious metals, that have been in your possession for over a lunar year.
Subtract Debts: Remove any immediate debts or liabilities from your asset total to find your net zakatable wealth.

Use a Zakat Calculator: Access a Zakat calculator provided by Africa Relief. This tool is designed to automatically factor in current Nisab values and calculate the exact amount of Zakat due based on the information you input.
Distribute Zakat: Upon calculation, you can directly contribute your Zakat through the same organization's platform, ensuring your donation supports essential relief efforts in African communities.

contents.body: Africa relief is a humanitarian aid organization dedicated to African relief work, offer Zakat calculator on the website, to make it easier for donors to fulfill their Islamic charitable obligations while contributing towards meaningful causes. By entering your asset details into the calculator, you can quickly determine your Zakat, which can then be seamlessly directed towards supporting poverty alleviation, education, healthcare, and emergency relief efforts in Africa. This method not only simplifies the calculation process but also connects your spiritual practice with impactful humanitarian aid.
How to pay zakat al mal?

Transform your spiritual duty into a lifeline for communities across Africa. Your Zakat can help provide clean water, healthcare, education, and emergency relief, breaking cycles of poverty and building stronger, more resilient communities.
Donate securely within this page & Stay engaged with the organization to see the real-world impact of your Zakat.

meta_description: Your Zakat al mal donation through Africa Relief transforms lives. Act now to uphold the spirit of giving. Donate today and be the change!

title: Gaza Emergency
excerpt: Support ARCD’s critical humanitarian efforts in Gaza, where over 1.5 million people are displaced and in desperate need of food, water, and medical care. Your donation can provide essential aid to the most vulnerable during this growing crisis.

contents.body: Gaza Donation
Support ARCD’s Critical Humanitarian Efforts in Gaza

After over 10 months of conflict, the people of Gaza face a dire humanitarian crisis. Over 1.5 million people are displaced and lacking food, water, and basic necessities. Hundreds of thousands of Gazans live under continuous bombardment. The humanitarian crisis is growing more severe by the day, with 18 hospitals forced to shut down, leaving countless individuals without access to critical medical care. The toll of this conflict is staggering. More than 40,000 people have lost their lives, the majority of them children and women. In the face of this unfolding tragedy, Africa Relief & Community Development (ARCD) is on the ground, providing food, water, hygiene kits, and medical care to those in desperate need. But we cannot do this alone. We urgently need your support to continue delivering essential aid to the most vulnerable.
Your Donation Can Make a Difference

body: $50 can provide emergency medical supplies to a clinic treating the wounded.
$100 can deliver fresh water and food to families who have lost everything.
$250 can help sustain ARCD’s ongoing efforts to bring relief and hope to those suffering in Gaza.

contents.body: Donate Now to Save Lives
Your contribution will directly support ARCD’s humanitarian efforts. Every donation, no matter the amount, helps us bring food, water, medical care, and hope to the people of Gaza.
Make Your Donation Today

The people of Gaza are facing unimaginable hardship, and they need our help more than ever. Please join us in this urgent mission to provide relief and save lives. Thank you for standing with us and the people of Gaza in this time of crisis.

body: Make your 100% zakat-eligible, tax-deductible emergency contribution now.
IRS Tax ID: 46-2568671

excerpt: Over 20% of elementary school children in Africa lack access to basic educational resources, with young women and students with disabilities disproportionately affected. Your minimum $25 donation can provide a student with essential school supplies, helping them achieve academic success and lifelong learning.

contents.body: School Bag Donation

Over 20% of elementary school children in Africa lack access to basic educational resources and opportunities. That number increases to more than 60% in teens between 15-17 years old, with young women and students with disabilities more than twice as likely to lack access to quality education. The COVID-19 pandemic caused further learning losses.
These children need your support to access inclusive and equitable early childhood development, quality education, and critical skills for employment and entrepreneurship.

body: For $25, you can provide a student in need with:
A backpack
Notebooks
Pens and pencils
Eraser and a ruler

contents.body: Your donation will help students achieve reading proficiency, graduate from primary and secondary school, and pursue lifelong learning.
Help young learners fulfill their potential. Sponsor a school bag today.

You can sponsor a school bag for $25, sponsor a student, or help build an educational center. Every contribution makes a difference. Donations to Africa Relief & Community Development are zakat-eligible and tax-deductible.
IRS Tax ID: 46-2568671

meta_title: Donate to Back to School with Africa Relief
meta_description: Your Back to School donation through Africa Relief transforms lives. Act now to uphold the spirit of giving. Donate today and be the change!

title: Aqiqah
excerpt: Aqiqah is a beloved Islamic tradition involving the sacrifice of an animal, typically a sheep or goat, as an expression of gratitude for the birth of a child.

contents.body: Celebrate the Birth of Your Child with Africa Relief’s Aqiqah Program

Childbirth is a moment of immense joy and gratitude. In Islam, the tradition of Aqiqah offers a way to celebrate this blessing while helping those in need. By donating your Aqiqah through Africa Relief, you can honor this Sunnah and bring relief to vulnerable families across Africa.
What is Aqiqah?

Aqiqah is a beloved Islamic tradition involving the sacrifice of an animal, typically a sheep or goat, as an expression of gratitude for the birth of a child. This act follows the example of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), who performed Aqiqah for his grandsons, Al-Hasan and Al-Husain (peace be upon them).
Why Donate Your Aqiqah Through ARCD?

body: ** Spiritual Fulfillment: ** Follow the Sunnah of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) while expressing gratitude to Allah for your child’s birth.
** Support for Vulnerable Families: ** In many communities across Africa, meat is a rare luxury. Your Aqiqah provides nutritious meals to widows, orphans, the elderly, and displaced families.
** Strengthen Community Bonds: ** Share the joy of your celebration by offering fresh meat or communal meals to those who need it most.

contents.body: How ARCD’s Aqiqah Program Works

body: ** Select Your Aqiqah Package: **  Call our Donor Care team at 855-273-6628 to discuss your options. Prices for livestock vary by region, ensuring your donation has the greatest impact.
** Optional Sadaqah: ** Fulfill another Sunnah by donating the weight of your child’s hair in silver to support families in need.
** Distribution: **  ARCD’s teams prepare and distribute meat packs or cook communal meals for vulnerable families, ensuring your donation reaches those most in need across Africa.

contents.body: Donate Your Aqiqah Today
Performing your Aqiqah through ARCD is simple, meaningful, and impactful. Every donation reflects gratitude for your blessing and brings hope to those in need.
Celebrate your child’s birth by sharing the joy with families in need. Together, we can bring sustenance, joy, and hope across Africa.

meta_title: Empower Lives, Transform Communities: Donate to ARCD - Donate now
meta_description: Join Africa Relief & Community Development (ARCD) in making a difference. Your donation will support life-saving initiatives, from emergency relief to sustainable development programs. Empower lives, transform communities. Donate now.
